intro: Leobordea mollis, commonly known as the silky leobordea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
